Read the raw file 2024_CSN_Number_of_Reports_by_Type.csv line-by-line and strip empty/blank lines.
Identify the header row as the first row that contains at least two non-empty comma-separated cells.
Keep subsequent rows only as long as they also contain at least two non-empty cells, thereby discarding footnotes or other non-tabular text that may follow the data block.

Clean every value in every column with convert_value: • trim whitespace • remove thousands commas • drop leading $ • translate K and M suffixes into ×1 000 or ×1 000 000 • convert numeric strings to int/float while leaving non-numeric text unchanged • keep NaN for blanks.
From the cleaned data frame pick the ‘Identity Theft ’ column for rows where Year == 2001 and Year == 2024.
Compute and print the ratio id_theft_2024 / id_theft_2001.
